name: QuackCryption
body: ### Description A website for the various QuackCryption projects made during Spartahack 2016. QuackCryption is a novel approach to data structures, app development, and encryption by four, 2nd-semester Purdue University computer science majors. In essence, either text or a file is inputted (along with maybe a passphrase of the user's choosing), the text is encrypted using 128-bit AES (in CBC mode), and then that text is then converted into 'Quack' code. The data encrypted can be decrypted back to its original form, bit-for-bit. The components made are as follows: * [Backend](https://github.com/Meegul304/DesktopQuackCryption) * [Android App](https://github.com/scottmangiapane/android-quackcryption) * Desktop App * [Web App](https://github.com/scottmangiapane/android-quackcryption/tree/master/website) ### Authors and Contributors * Michael Bilstein (@Meegul304) --- Backend * Kevin Dong (@kevindong) --- Backend and Web App * Scott Mangiapane (@scottmangiapane) --- Android App and Graphic Design * Vikram Pasumarti (@vk117) --- Desktop App ### License All rights reserved.
